name: ModelComponent
desc: A collection of resources that create the visual appearance of an entity.

items.name: init(mesh: MeshResource, materials: [Material])
items.desc: Creates a model component from a mesh and a collection of materials.

items.name: var mesh: MeshResource
items.desc: The mesh that defines the shape of the entity.

items.name: class MeshResource
items.desc: A high-level representation of a collection of vertices and edges that define a shape.

items.name: var materials: [Material]
items.desc: The materials used by the model.

items.name: struct SimpleMaterial
items.desc: A basic material that you can apply to meshes.

items.name: struct PhysicallyBasedMaterial
items.desc: A material that simulates the appearance of real-world objects.

items.name: struct CustomMaterial
items.desc: A material that works with custom Metal shader functions.

items.name: struct UnlitMaterial
items.desc: A simple material that doesn’t respond to lights in the scene.

items.name: struct OcclusionMaterial
items.desc: An invisible material that hides objects rendered behind it.

items.name: struct VideoMaterial
items.desc: A material that supports animated textures.

items.name: protocol Material
items.desc: A type that describes the material aspects of a mesh, like color and texture.

items.name: enum MaterialColorParameter
items.desc: The color parameter applied to a material.

items.name: enum MaterialScalarParameter
items.desc: The scalar parameter applied to a material.

items.name: struct MaterialParameterTypes
items.desc: A set of typesused for material parameters.

items.name: var boundsMargin: Float
items.desc: A margin applied to an entity’s bounding box that determines object visibility.
